instruction:
Design an outline for a blog post based on the given information and list the sections accordingly.

This blog post is going to about making a list of last-minute gift ideas. Also, the tone of the post is going to be relaxed and casual.
output:
Title: "Last-Minute Gift Ideas: Because Procrastination is a Virtue"

I. Introduction
   A. Explanation of the blog post's purpose
   B. Mention the target audience (procrastinators and last-minute shoppers)
   C. Set a relaxed and casual tone

II. Section 1: Gift Ideas for Everyone
   A. General gifts that can be suitable for anyone
   B. Examples: Gift cards, donations to charity, personalized items
   C. Explanation of each idea

III. Section 2: Gift Ideas for Friends
   A. Specific gift suggestions for friends
   B. Examples: Friendship bracelets, personalized photo albums, unique experiences
   C. Explanation of each idea

IV. Section 3: Gift Ideas for Family
   A. Specific gift suggestions for family members
   B. Examples: Personalized kitchenware, family photo frames, cozy home items
   C. Explanation of each idea

V. Section 4: Gift Ideas for Significant Others
   A. Specific gift suggestions for partners
   B. Examples: Romantic getaways, personalized jewelry, luxurious home items
   C. Explanation of each idea

VI. Section 5: Gift Ideas for Coworkers
   A. Specific gift suggestions for coworkers
   B. Examples: Office accessories, gourmet food, team-building experiences
   C. Explanation of each idea

VII. Conclusion
   A. Recap of the last-minute gift ideas
   B. Encourage readers to choose the perfect gift based on their relationships
   C. Maintain the relaxed and casual tone

This outline provides a clear structure for the blog post, covering various sections that cater to different types of recipients. It allows readers to easily find gift ideas that suit their needs, while maintaining a relaxed and casual tone.
